# M. P. Woodward

| website      =
}}
Michael Patrick Woodward, also known as M. P. Woodward, is an American novelist. He is known for the Jack Ryan Jr. novels, which are part of the Ryanverse featuring characters created by Tom Clancy, as well as his own Handler series of espionage novels.
Early life and career
Woodward worked as a naval intelligence officer with the United States Indo-Pacific Command, where he wrote scenarios for wargame exercises. He later worked for Amazon Prime Video as head of its international distribution marketing department.
Woodward published his debut novel, The Handler, in 2022. It was inspired by his experiences in the intelligence community. It was followed by Dead Drop (2023).
Woodward took over from Don Bentley as the writer of the Jack Ryan Jr. series of novels, which is set in Tom Clancy's Ryanverse. His debut, Tom Clancy: Shadow State, was released in 2024. It was followed by Tom Clancy: Line of Demarcation and Tom Clancy: Terminal Velocity (both 2025). Woodward is slated to take over from Ward Larsen as the writer of the Jack Ryan novels in 2026, with Jack Stewart replacing him as author of the Jack Junior novels.
In 2025, Woodward released a war novel titled Red Tide, about a fictional war between the U.S. and China over Taiwan, which has drawn comparisons to Clancy's novel Red Storm Rising (1986).
